item.title: Graph-Relational Database with EdgeDB
item.description:
I built a Jupyter notebook that creates a graph database in EdgeDB from Yelp data of Chicago business reviews. Data was supplemented with Google Maps location data using the Google Maps API.

Python, pandas, EdgeDB

item.title: Web Scraping NFL Draft Data with R Using rvest
item.description:
NFL.com hosts archived scouting reports for college players ready to be selected in the annual NFL draft. I wrote a script in R using the rvest package that scraped every available pre-draft player page from NFL.com to get the various attributes for each player (name, year selected, college, position) and the player’s scouting report summary text (overview, strengths, weaknesses). A sample of the resulting data frame is below:

R, rvest

item.title: Sentiment Analysis
item.description:
Undergraduate capstone project training a SVM model with sentiment-graded reviews from IMDB, Amazon, and Yelp. It was great at detecting negative sentiment but not so great at detecting positive sentiment. There are probably just more ways to say you like something than to say you don’t like something, so the negative words bear greater weight.

The ten most influential terms in the model:

R, Rtexttools, dplyr, MASS, e1071

item.title: About Chris Caldwell
item.description: About Chris Caldwell: father, husband, hiker, data scientist, reasonably fun at parties.
